greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A Pell-Pascal matrix.
comment: Row sums are A106514. Antidiagonal sums are A106515.
This triangle gives the iterated partial sums of the Pell sequence A000129(n+1), n>=0. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Oct 05 2014
formula: Number triangle T(n,0) = A000129(n+1), T(n,k) = T(n-1,k-1) + T(n-1,k); T(n,k) = Sum_{j=0..floor((n+1)/2)} binomial(n+1, 2j+k+1)2^j.
O.g.f. for row polynomials R(n,x) = Sum_{k=0..n} T(n,k)*x^k: (1 - z)/((1 - 2*z - z^2)*(1 - (1+x)*z)).
O.g.f. column m: (1/(1 - 2*z - z^2))*(x/(1 - x)))^m, m >= 0. (Riordan property).
The alternating row sums are shown in A001333.

A-sequence: [1, 1] (see the three term recurrence given above). Z-sequence has o.g.f. (2 + 3*x)/(1 + x), [2, 1, repeat(-1,1)] (unsigned A054977). See the W. Lang link under A006232 for Riordan A- and Z-sequences.
The inverse Riordan triangle is shown in A248156. (End)
example: Recurrence from the Z-sequence (see the formula above) for T(0,n) in terms of the entries of row n-1. For example, 29 = T(4,0) = 2*12 + 1*8 + (-1)*4 + 1*1 = 29. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Oct 05 2014
results.author: _Paul Barry_, May 05 2005
